Featured Recipe

Tuesday Night Grey Casserole

Prep: 11 min  |  Cook: 45 min  |  Regret: lifetime  |  Serves: whoever shows up

A casserole that asks nothing of you and expects even less. The grey is a feature, not a bug. Pairs well with a long exhale and the evening news.

Ingredients

  • ‚òÖ 2 cans cream of mushroom soup (the foundation of all honest cooking)
  • 1 lb ground beef, browned and drained of ambition
  • 3 cups egg noodles, cooked to compliance
  • 1 cup sour cream (full fat ‚Äî we are past pretending)
  • 1 bag frozen mixed vegetables, still partially frozen, it's fine
  • 1 cup shredded cheddar, the orange kind, from the bag
  • Salt to taste. Pepper if you're feeling reckless.

Mildred's Corner

I started this website the same week I signed the divorce papers and bought a new can opener. Not because I needed a new one. Because choosing a can opener was the first decision I got to make alone in thirty-one years, and I wanted it to be a good one. It was. It's a Swing-A-Way. It works every time.

People ask me why I don't try new recipes. I tell them I don't try new recipes for the same reason I don't try new personalities ‚Äî the old ones work fine and nobody's watching anyway. There is a quiet dignity in lowered expectations. Not everything needs to be a revelation. Some nights you just need a casserole that doesn't ask questions.

Stanley, if you're reading this: the gravy was always lukewarm.
